subsections.title: Overview of OpenAI
subsections.content: OpenAI is an artificial intelligence research organization founded with the mission to ensure that artificial general intelligence (AGI) benefits all of humanity. It conducts research on AI with a focus on safety, generalization across tasks, and the implications of AI development. OpenAI is known for both its for-profit and non-profit models and has made significant contributions to the field of AI through its research papers, software, and machine learning models.

subsections.title: Founding of OpenAI
subsections.content: OpenAI was founded in December 2015 by Elon Musk, Sam Altman, Greg Brockman, Ilya Sutskever, Wojciech Zaremba, and John Schulman. The founding was driven by concerns over the potential existential risks of AGI and a desire to direct its progress for the betterment of humanity. The organization was launched with a $1 billion commitment from its founders and other investors, including LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman, PayPal co-founder Peter Thiel, Amazon Web Services, Infosys, and YC Research.

subsections.title: Launch of OpenAI Gym
subsections.content: In April 2016, OpenAI released OpenAI Gym, a toolkit for developing and comparing reinforcement learning algorithms. The platform consists of a collection of environments which can be used to test intelligent agents, ranging from classic control problems and algorithmic tasks to Atari games and robot simulation environments. Gym provides a simple, flexible API to benchmark reinforcement learning techniques, significantly advancing the research community's ability to study and develop AI.

subsections.title: OpenAI Five
subsections.content: In 2018, OpenAI introduced OpenAI Five, a team of AI bots trained to play the video game Dota 2 at a professional level. Leveraging deep reinforcement learning and large-scale training using hundreds of GPUs, OpenAI Five defeated semi-professional and amateur human teams, and later in 2019, it beat one of the world's best professional Dota 2 teams, OG, in a public demonstration. OpenAI Five showcased the potential for AI to grasp complex strategy and teamwork in a collaborative environment.

subsections.title: GPT Models
subsections.content: One of OpenAI's most significant contributions to AI has been the development of the Generative Pre-trained Transformer (GPT) models. GPT-2, released in 2019, demonstrated the ability to generate coherent and contextually relevant text. Its successor, GPT-3, released in 2020, further illustrated the power of large language models with 175 billion parameters, enabling it to perform a wide variety of language tasks, from translation and summarization to code generation and creative writing. These models have propelled OpenAI to the forefront of AI research and industry application.

subsections.title: Transition to OpenAI LP
subsections.content: In 2019, OpenAI transitioned from a non-profit model to a 'capped-profit' structure under the banner of OpenAI LP. This reorganization was designed to facilitate a sustainable model for acquiring resources, talent, and data necessary to continue its advances in AI research. Under this structure, OpenAI remains governed by its original nonprofit board, ensuring that the company's mission to benefit humanity stays prioritized, while still allowing it to attract investment by offering capped returns to investors.

subsections.title: Partnership with Microsoft
subsections.content: In July 2019, OpenAI formed a strategic partnership with Microsoft, receiving a $1 billion investment to support the development of AGI. The partnership involves infrastructural collaboration, with Microsoft providing the Azure cloud services necessary for the computational demands of OpenAI’s projects. Additionally, the collaboration has enabled the integrations of OpenAI’s models with Microsoft’s own products and services, considerably expanding the reach and applicability of OpenAI’s technological advancements.

subsections.title: Innovations in Safety and Policy
subsections.content: Throughout its journey, OpenAI has emphasized the importance of safe and controlled AI deployment. It has conducted substantive research regarding the social and ethical implications of AI, and worked on developing frameworks for responsible AI governance and usage. OpenAI’s strategies include publishing technical papers, engaging with the public and policymakers for transparency, and developing technologies that facilitate fair and broad access to powerful AI tools.

subsections.title: Research Focus and Goals
subsections.content: As OpenAI moves forward, its focus remains on ensuring that AGI, when created, is safe and has a positive impact on society. The organization aims to push the boundaries of AI safety research, improve the alignment of AI systems with human values, and strive towards achieving greater AI explainability and robustness. It intends to foster global cooperation in AI development and policy formulation to address the potential challenges poised by rapidly advancing AI technologies.

subsections.title: Public Collaborations and Outreach
subsections.content: OpenAI is continuously seeking to increase its engagement with the global research community and the public at large. By strengthening collaborations across academia, industry, and governments worldwide, OpenAI endeavors to promote an open dialogue around the ethical development of AI, empower developers and users through educational tools, and refine policy frameworks to address concerns over privacy, bias, and the economic impacts of AI proliferation.
